question: Hhhh I'm sorry can I possibly have a scenario where izu is pegged by his girlfriend
answer:
TW: NSFW

Shyly, he toys with his fingers. “Yeah, I am. I want to try this with you.” He looks up at you, his green eyes glinting off your end table lamp. You nod your head, stepping into the strap on you two had just bought a few hours earlier.

“Grab the lube for me?” Izuku perks up, and then moves to the side of the bed where he opens up the end table drawer, pulling out your lube. He hands it to you, and you can tell he’s nervous, so you lean in and kiss him. “I’ll be gentle,” you promise, and he believes you, smiling up at you as he begins to get himself ready on the bed.

You take the lube, applying some to your fingers, and gently you begin to prob at his back entrance. You feel him shiver as he curls into himself a little, a shaky breath exiting his lips. You make sure to go slowly, starting with one finger, and then working your way up to two. “Are you ready baby?” You ask, and not trusting his voice he simply nods. After lubing up the strap on, you enter him slowly, feeling a slight resistance. He whimpers, fists balling into the sheets, not used to something so large up his ass.

“How do you feel?” You ask him through slow thrusts.

“Amazing,” he whispers. “Please don’t stop.” So you don’t, and you plunge into him again and again, nails digging into his hips, breath heavy as you work your body in all new ways.

blog.name: makeste
blog.title: watashi ga kita bitch
blog.description: makeste (muh-KEST). female; mid-thirties. I do weekly liveblogs of bnha, a series I've grown to love to an unhealthy degree. plus me some ultra

summary: first off, thank you!!  and as for Shigaraki, my opinion of him hasn’t really changed since the end of the USJ arc, I think....
body:
first off, thank you!!

and as for Shigaraki, my opinion of him hasn’t really changed since the end of the USJ arc, I think. that is to say, it hasn’t changed since I first realized he was basically just a kid still and being manipulated by the Skype Villain. ever since then, I’ve been more or less sympathetic toward him (though with a lot of side-eye involved because. dude has some fucking screws loose). thus far he seems to be pretty in over his head most of the time, trying to hatch plots but not really having much success. he’s pretty fucking unstable, but he’s trying though.

let’s see if I can kind of summarize my impressions arc by arc. not sure how accurate this is gonna be; going off memory here. anyways, this is a bit long and includes spoilers from past where I’m currently up to in the recaps, so I’m putting it behind a cut just in case.

USJ arc

  • whoa look at this creepy guy with all these hands
  • HE’S SO FUCKING CREEPY
  • DEAD KIDS
  • yes he got shot, fucking serves you right you creep
  • bye felicia
  • oh my god he’s just a kid… that actually makes sense
  • maybe he can be redeemed after all I GUESS WE’LL SEE

(I’m skipping the sports festival arc because he wasn’t really in it much)

Hero Killer Arc

  • “hey dude do you want to join our evil league of evil?”
  • yeah this is definitely a fucking kid idk how I didn’t see it before
  • Deku is goddamn lucky these villains can’t seem to get their shit together for longer than two seconds
  • this guy really fucking hates All Might
  • why is his mouth so fucking wide
  • during this arc it also became even more apparent that his relationship with the Skype Villain/All for One was basically that of a parent/child. after chapter 59 I was basically convinced that he was All for One’s biological son
  • and also Tomura was dragging Stain and complaining about him basically from the beginning, and once Stain finally got on my last nerve too I was all about that. like, yes. he is the worst, agreed.

Fanfic Lodge arc

  • oh yeah, so once I learned that the kids were all going to go to a forest lodge for training over their summer break, I got really excited and started referring to it as “the fanfic lodge” because of it being such a perfect setting for fanficcy hijinks. like, you know. a bunch of kids all getting up to youthful shenanigans and the like. so yeah you will see this a lot once the recaps hit that point
  • anyway. so first off, this is when he met Dabi the house elf! and Toga!
  • anyway so he hated them from the start and was rasslin’ with them but Kurogiri was doing his best to break that shit up, and encouraging Tomura to be nice and make friends. and then Tomura basically went off to sulk…
  • and then he ran into Deku at the mall :’D
  • and that chapter was weird, let me tell you. getting into Tomura’s headspace was a trip and a half. and then he fucking meets up with Deku and fucking starts asking him for advice of all things?? and Deku gives it to him??? and at this point I basically had no clue where it was going to lead because Tomura is so fucking unstable and unpredictable. but in the end this meeting reinforced the whole “he really hates All Might” thing even more, and then he almost killed Deku but he didn’t and then he got away

Baku Rescue/Villain Hideout Raid arc

  • okay so during this arc Tomura seemed to have changed a lot from when we’d last seen him. he was actually leading this villain group all of a sudden, and not just throwing tantrums and sulking and hating everyone. and apparently it was his idea to kidnap Bakugou, which I still want to know just why he was so insistent on him being an important pawn btw. but anyway, I spent a lot of time freaking out about what his aim was, because I was pretty sure Bakugou wasn’t going to give them the time of day so I was worried what would happen once they finally realized that
  • but then the pros showed up! and then All for One! and then Bakugou got rescued and All for One sent Tomura away before he could be captured too. so at this point it became clear just how invested All for One was in Tomura, and how serious he was about making him his successor. and he seems to have a lot more confidence in him than I do. like, idk, to me he still seems like a hot mess for the most part. what AfO has done very successfully though is to stoke his hatred, and manipulate and twist him into hating All Might and heroes in general with every fiber of his body. and that’s a dangerous fucking thing
  • and of course, this was when we got the Shimura revelation. but honestly, that didn’t change things much as far as my opinion of him goes. except now All Might wants to redeem him, so now that option is more officially on the table. this is something I expect will be explored for the rest of the series. whether he can be turned back or not
  • I also feel bad for him having lost his mentor so suddenly, and I’m really curious to see what’s going to happen with him from this point. will he step up and mature? All for One seems to think he will. idk; I’m thinking it’ll be a little while before I see him again just because the last arc was so heavy on the villain mythology that I think we’ll back off for at least a few chapters and probably do something a bit lighter and more school-focused again. but what do I know lol
  • so either way, I suspect there are more major changes for his character on the horizon, but exactly what remains to be seen


anyways, I’m pretty sure that’s it for now. so that’s my Tomura journey thus far. in more detail than anyone asked for, but I hadn’t thought about it much before now so I got carried away lol.

  • and also Tomura was dragging Stain and complaining about him basically from the beginning, and once Stain finally got on my last nerve too I was all about that. like, yes. he is the worst, agreed.

Fanfic Lodge arc

  • oh yeah, so once I learned that the kids were all going to go to a forest lodge for training over their summer break, I got really excited and started referring to it as “the fanfic lodge” because of it being such a perfect setting for fanficcy hijinks. like, you know. a bunch of kids all getting up to youthful shenanigans and the like. so yeah you will see this a lot once the recaps hit that point
  • anyway. so first off, this is when he met Dabi the house elf! and Toga!
  • anyway so he hated them from the start and was rasslin’ with them but Kurogiri was doing his best to break that shit up, and encouraging Tomura to be nice and make friends. and then Tomura basically went off to sulk…
  • and then he ran into Deku at the mall :’D
  • and that chapter was weird, let me tell you. getting into Tomura’s headspace was a trip and a half. and then he fucking meets up with Deku and fucking starts asking him for advice of all things?? and Deku gives it to him??? and at this point I basically had no clue where it was going to lead because Tomura is so fucking unstable and unpredictable. but in the end this meeting reinforced the whole “he really hates All Might” thing even more, and then he almost killed Deku but he didn’t and then he got away

Baku Rescue/Villain Hideout Raid arc

  • okay so during this arc Tomura seemed to have changed a lot from when we’d last seen him. he was actually leading this villain group all of a sudden, and not just throwing tantrums and sulking and hating everyone. and apparently it was his idea to kidnap Bakugou, which I still want to know just why he was so insistent on him being an important pawn btw. but anyway, I spent a lot of time freaking out about what his aim was, because I was pretty sure Bakugou wasn’t going to give them the time of day so I was worried what would happen once they finally realized that
  • but then the pros showed up! and then All for One! and then Bakugou got rescued and All for One sent Tomura away before he could be captured too. so at this point it became clear just how invested All for One was in Tomura, and how serious he was about making him his successor. and he seems to have a lot more confidence in him than I do. like, idk, to me he still seems like a hot mess for the most part. what AfO has done very successfully though is to stoke his hatred, and manipulate and twist him into hating All Might and heroes in general with every fiber of his body. and that’s a dangerous fucking thing
  • and of course, this was when we got the Shimura revelation. but honestly, that didn’t change things much as far as my opinion of him goes. except now All Might wants to redeem him, so now that option is more officially on the table. this is something I expect will be explored for the rest of the series. whether he can be turned back or not
  • I also feel bad for him having lost his mentor so suddenly, and I’m really curious to see what’s going to happen with him from this point. will he step up and mature? All for One seems to think he will. idk; I’m thinking it’ll be a little while before I see him again just because the last arc was so heavy on the villain mythology that I think we’ll back off for at least a few chapters and probably do something a bit lighter and more school-focused again. but what do I know lol
  • so either way, I suspect there are more major changes for his character on the horizon, but exactly what remains to be seen


anyways, I’m pretty sure that’s it for now. so that’s my Tomura journey thus far. in more detail than anyone asked for, but I hadn’t thought about it much before now so I got carried away lol.

  • HE’S SO FUCKING CREEPY
  • DEAD KIDS
  • yes he got shot, fucking serves you right you creep
  • bye felicia
  • oh my god he’s just a kid… that actually makes sense
  • maybe he can be redeemed after all I GUESS WE’LL SEE

(I’m skipping the sports festival arc because he wasn’t really in it much)

Hero Killer Arc

  • “hey dude do you want to join our evil league of evil?”
  • yeah this is definitely a fucking kid idk how I didn’t see it before
  • Deku is goddamn lucky these villains can’t seem to get their shit together for longer than two seconds
  • this guy really fucking hates All Might
  • why is his mouth so fucking wide
  • during this arc it also became even more apparent that his relationship with the Skype Villain/All for One was basically that of a parent/child. after chapter 59 I was basically convinced that he was All for One’s biological son
  • and also Tomura was dragging Stain and complaining about him basically from the beginning, and once Stain finally got on my last nerve too I was all about that. like, yes. he is the worst, agreed.

Fanfic Lodge arc

  • oh yeah, so once I learned that the kids were all going to go to a forest lodge for training over their summer break, I got really excited and started referring to it as “the fanfic lodge” because of it being such a perfect setting for fanficcy hijinks. like, you know. a bunch of kids all getting up to youthful shenanigans and the like. so yeah you will see this a lot once the recaps hit that point
  • anyway. so first off, this is when he met Dabi the house elf! and Toga!
  • anyway so he hated them from the start and was rasslin’ with them but Kurogiri was doing his best to break that shit up, and encouraging Tomura to be nice and make friends. and then Tomura basically went off to sulk…
  • and then he ran into Deku at the mall :’D
  • and that chapter was weird, let me tell you. getting into Tomura’s headspace was a trip and a half. and then he fucking meets up with Deku and fucking starts asking him for advice of all things?? and Deku gives it to him??? and at this point I basically had no clue where it was going to lead because Tomura is so fucking unstable and unpredictable. but in the end this meeting reinforced the whole “he really hates All Might” thing even more, and then he almost killed Deku but he didn’t and then he got away

Baku Rescue/Villain Hideout Raid arc

  • okay so during this arc Tomura seemed to have changed a lot from when we’d last seen him. he was actually leading this villain group all of a sudden, and not just throwing tantrums and sulking and hating everyone. and apparently it was his idea to kidnap Bakugou, which I still want to know just why he was so insistent on him being an important pawn btw. but anyway, I spent a lot of time freaking out about what his aim was, because I was pretty sure Bakugou wasn’t going to give them the time of day so I was worried what would happen once they finally realized that
  • but then the pros showed up! and then All for One! and then Bakugou got rescued and All for One sent Tomura away before he could be captured too. so at this point it became clear just how invested All for One was in Tomura, and how serious he was about making him his successor. and he seems to have a lot more confidence in him than I do. like, idk, to me he still seems like a hot mess for the most part. what AfO has done very successfully though is to stoke his hatred, and manipulate and twist him into hating All Might and heroes in general with every fiber of his body. and that’s a dangerous fucking thing
  • and of course, this was when we got the Shimura revelation. but honestly, that didn’t change things much as far as my opinion of him goes. except now All Might wants to redeem him, so now that option is more officially on the table. this is something I expect will be explored for the rest of the series. whether he can be turned back or not
  • I also feel bad for him having lost his mentor so suddenly, and I’m really curious to see what’s going to happen with him from this point. will he step up and mature? All for One seems to think he will. idk; I’m thinking it’ll be a little while before I see him again just because the last arc was so heavy on the villain mythology that I think we’ll back off for at least a few chapters and probably do something a bit lighter and more school-focused again. but what do I know lol
  • so either way, I suspect there are more major changes for his character on the horizon, but exactly what remains to be seen


anyways, I’m pretty sure that’s it for now. so that’s my Tomura journey thus far. in more detail than anyone asked for, but I hadn’t thought about it much before now so I got carried away lol.
trail.content_abstract:
first off, thank you!!

and as for Shigaraki, my opinion of him hasn’t really changed since the end of the USJ arc, I think. that is to say, it hasn’t changed since I first realized he was basically just a kid still and being manipulated by the Skype Villain. ever since then, I’ve been more or less sympathetic toward him (though with a lot of side-eye involved because. dude has some fucking screws loose). thus far he seems to be pretty in over his head most of the time, trying to hatch plots but not really having much success. he’s pretty fucking unstable, but he’s trying though.

let’s see if I can kind of summarize my impressions arc by arc. not sure how accurate this is gonna be; going off memory here. anyways, this is a bit long and includes spoilers from past where I’m currently up to in the recaps, so I’m putting it behind a cut just in case.

body:
okay but

have y’all SEEN kaminaris room? that’s LITERALLY a highschool adhd reality

all those random trinkets and forgotten hobby items?? ADHD!

how there’s literally no theme to it whatsoever?? ADHD!

summary:
Tetsutetsu: Imagine if someone handed you a box of all the items you've lost throughout your lifetime.
Awase: Oh wow, my...
body:
Tetsutetsu: Imagine if someone handed you a box of all the items you've lost throughout your lifetime.
Awase: Oh wow, my childhood innocence! Thanks for finding that!
Kuroiro: My will to live! I haven't seen this in years!
Rin: I knew I lost that potential somewhere!
Monoma: Mental stability, my old friend!
Kendo: Guys, could you lighten up a little?

tags: UGH i have to many ideas
the whole bakukami dynamic is So Gooooood
i LOVE kouda but? like? how would he notice bakugous hod
summary: as much as i like the unlikely friendship kouda and bakugou would have i feel like kaminari would be the first to communicate...
body:
as much as i like the unlikely friendship kouda and bakugou would have i feel like kaminari would be the first to communicate with bakugou via sign language?

like kaminari would be annoying him and bakugou would just violently sign some swear words at him and kaminari retaliates with even more violent but positive sign language and bakugou is so !!!!?!!!!?!???

kaminari would learn sign language bc of his quirk and how it makes him basically non-verbal + his adhd sometimes just makes him Not Talk bc That’s Hard and so he learnt sign language!!

plus? kaminari hangs around bakugou more than kouda ever would so i think that kaminari would be more aware of bakugous hard of hearing.

caption:
Day 9: Your own Quirk! 

Quirk: Molecule Manipulation

-a lot like Miro’s but instead of your own molecules phasing through, the other molecules move out of the way causing a ripple effect! (works best on clear surfaces)
